verses.kjv: Concerning the divisions of the porters: Of the Korhites was Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
verses.web: For the divisions of the doorkeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.
verses.ct: Here are the divisions of the gatekeepers: From the Korahites, there was Meshelemiah son of Kore, one of the descendants of Asaph.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Meshelemiah were, Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
verses.web: Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,
verses.ct: Meshelemiah's sons were Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,

verses.kjv: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Elioenai the seventh.
verses.web: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Eliehoenai the seventh.
verses.ct: Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, and Elioenai the seventh.

verses.kjv: Moreover the sons of Obededom were, Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethaneel the fifth,
verses.web: Obed-Edom had sons: Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethanel the fifth,
verses.ct: Obededom's sons were Shemaiah the firstborn, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, Sacar the fourth, Nethaneel the fifth,

verses.kjv: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peulthai the eighth: for God blessed him.
verses.web: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.
verses.ct: Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, and Peulthai the eighth — for God had blessed him with many sons.

verses.kjv: Also unto Shemaiah his son were sons born, that ruled throughout the house of their father: for they were mighty men of valour.
verses.web: Sons were also born to Shemaiah his son, who ruled over the house of their father; for they were mighty men of valor.
verses.ct: Shemaiah, Obededom's firstborn, also had sons who became leaders in their father's household because they were strong and capable men.

verses.kjv: The sons of Shemaiah; Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad, whose brethren were strong men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
verses.web: The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad, whose brothers were valiant men, Elihu, and Semachiah.
verses.ct: Shemaiah's sons were Othni, Rephael, Obed, and Elzabad. His relatives Elihu and Semachiah were also strong, capable men.

verses.kjv: All these of the sons of Obededom: they and their sons and their brethren, able men for strength for the service, were threescore and two of Obededom.
verses.web: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom: they and their sons and their brothers, able men in strength for the service: sixty-two of Obed-Edom.
verses.ct: All of these were descendants of Obededom. Together with their sons and relatives, they were strong and well-suited for the work — 62 men in all from Obededom's family.

verses.kjv: And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, strong men, eighteen.
verses.web: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, valiant men, eighteen.
verses.ct: Meshelemiah had sons and relatives who were strong men — 18 in all.

verses.kjv: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons; Simri the chief, (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him the chief;)
verses.web: Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the firstborn, yet his father made him chief),
verses.ct: Hosah, from the descendants of Merari, also had sons. Simri was the chief — even though he wasn't the firstborn, his father appointed him as the leader.

verses.kjv: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.
verses.web: Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. All the sons and brothers of Hosah were thirteen.
verses.ct: Hilkiah was the second, Tebaliah the third, and Zechariah the fourth. Hosah's sons and relatives totaled 13.

verses.kjv: Among these were the divisions of the porters, even among the chief men, having wards one against another, to minister in the house of the LORD.
verses.web: Of these were the divisions of the doorkeepers, even of the chief men, having offices like their brothers, to minister in LORD’s house.
verses.ct: These gatekeepers were organized into divisions led by their chief men. They were assigned duties just like their fellow Levites, serving in the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to the house of their fathers, for every gate.
verses.web: They cast lots, the small as well as the great, according to their fathers’ houses, for every gate.
verses.ct: They cast lots to determine which gate each family would guard — young and old alike, with no favoritism based on family size.

verses.kjv: And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counsellor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
verses.web: The lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a wise counselor, they cast lots; and his lot came out northward.
verses.ct: The east gate was assigned to Shelemiah. Then they cast lots for his son Zechariah, who was known as a wise counselor, and he was assigned the north gate.

verses.kjv: To Obededom southward; and to his sons the house of Asuppim.
verses.web: To Obed-Edom southward; and to his sons the storehouse.
verses.ct: Obededom was assigned the south gate, and his sons were put in charge of the storehouses.

verses.kjv: To Shuppim and Hosah the lot came forth westward, with the gate Shallecheth, by the causeway of the going up, ward against ward.
verses.web: To Shuppim and Hosah westward, by the gate of Shallecheth, at the causeway that goes up, watchman opposite watchman.
verses.ct: Shuppim and Hosah were assigned the west side, at the Shallecheth Gate near the upper road, with guards stationed opposite each other.

verses.kjv: Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and toward Asuppim two and two.
verses.web: Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and for the storehouse two and two.
verses.ct: Each day, 6 Levites were posted on the east side, 4 on the north, 4 on the south, and 2 pairs at the storehouses.

verses.kjv: At Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.
verses.web: For Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.
verses.ct: At the court on the west side, 4 guards stood at the road and 2 at the court itself.

verses.kjv: These are the divisions of the porters among the sons of Kore, and among the sons of Merari.
verses.web: These were the divisions of the doorkeepers; of the sons of the Korahites, and of the sons of Merari.
verses.ct: These were the divisions of the gatekeepers from the descendants of Kore and the descendants of Merari.

verses.kjv: And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
verses.web: Of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of God’s house and over the treasures of the dedicated things.
verses.ct: Among the other Levites, Ahijah was in charge of the treasuries of God's house and the treasuries where dedicated gifts were kept.

verses.kjv: As concerning the sons of Laadan; the sons of the Gershonite Laadan, chief fathers, even of Laadan the Gershonite, were Jehieli.
verses.web: The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the fathers’ households belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.
verses.ct: From the descendants of Laadan the Gershonite, the family heads of Laadan's line included Jehieli.

verses.kjv: The sons of Jehieli; Zetham, and Joel his brother, which were over the treasures of the house of the LORD.
verses.web: The sons of Jehieli: Zetham, and Joel his brother, over the treasures of LORD’s house.
verses.ct: Jehieli's sons, Zetham and his brother Joel, were responsible for the treasuries of the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Of the Amramites, and the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites:
verses.web: Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, of the Uzzielites:
verses.ct: From the clans of the Amramites, Izharites, Hebronites, and Uzzielites:

verses.kjv: And Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler of the treasures.
verses.web: and Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler over the treasures.
verses.ct: Shebuel son of Gershom, the grandson of Moses, served as the chief official over the treasuries.

verses.kjv: And his brethren by Eliezer; Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomith his son.
verses.web: His brothers: of Eliezer, Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri his son, and Shelomoth his son.
verses.ct: His relatives through Eliezer's line were Rehabiah his son, then Jeshaiah, then Joram, then Zichri, and then Shelomith.

verses.kjv: Which Shelomith and his brethren were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the chief fathers, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the host, had dedicated.
verses.web: This Shelomoth and his brothers were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the heads of the fathers’ households, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the army, had dedicated.
verses.ct: Shelomith and his relatives were in charge of all the treasuries holding the items that King David, the family heads, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and the army officers had dedicated to God.

verses.kjv: Out of the spoils won in battles did they dedicate to maintain the house of the LORD.
verses.web: They dedicated some of the plunder won in battles to repair LORD’s house.
verses.ct: They had set aside plunder won in battle specifically to fund the upkeep of the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, had dedicated; and whosoever had dedicated any thing, it was under the hand of Shelomith, and of his brethren.
verses.web: All that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, had dedicated, whoever had dedicated anything, it was under the hand of Shelomoth, and of his brothers.
verses.ct: Everything dedicated by Samuel the seer, Saul son of Kish, Abner son of Ner, and Joab son of Zeruiah — in fact, anything anyone had ever dedicated — was placed under the care of Shelomith and his relatives.

verses.kjv: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.
verses.web: Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.
verses.ct: From the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were assigned to handle civic duties throughout Israel, serving as officials and judges.

verses.kjv: And of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valour, a thousand and seven hundred, were officers among them of Israel on this side Jordan westward in all the business of the LORD, and in the service of the king.
verses.web: Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brothers, men of valor, one thousand seven hundred, had the oversight of Israel beyond the Jordan westward, for all the business of LORD, and for the service of the king.
verses.ct: From the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his relatives — 1,700 capable men — were put in charge of Israel's affairs west of the Jordan, handling both the LORD's work and the king's business.

verses.kjv: Among the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even among the Hebronites, according to the generations of his fathers. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valour at Jazer of Gilead.
verses.web: Of the Hebronites, Jerijah was the chief, even of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers’ households. They were sought for in the fortieth year of the reign of David, and mighty men of valor were found among them at Jazer of Gilead.
verses.ct: Jerijah was the chief of the Hebronites, traced through their family records. In the 40th year of David's reign, a search was conducted, and mighty warriors from this clan were found at Jazer in Gilead.

verses.kjv: And his brethren, men of valour, were two thousand and seven hundred chief fathers, whom king David made rulers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh, for every matter pertaining to God, and affairs of the king.
verses.web: His brothers, men of valor, were two thousand seven hundred, heads of fathers’ households, whom king David made overseers over the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of the Manassites, for every matter pertaining to God, and for the affairs of the king.
verses.ct: Jerijah had 2,700 relatives who were capable men and heads of families. King David put them in charge of the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, overseeing everything related to God's service and the king's affairs.
